name: Garlic and Onion Boiled Peanuts
author: Anonymous
summary: Here's an original twist to a Southern favorite. The garlic flavor really comes out in this recipe whether the peanuts are served hot or cold.  I love them served room temperature with a cold beer on a summer day! You can also begin cooking the peanuts, then let them soak overnight, and continue cooking the next day. Serve hot or cold, and make sure you have plenty of napkins on hand because these are messy.
ingredients: 1 ½ pounds raw peanuts, in shells
directions: Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat
Stir in the onion and garlic; cook until softened and transparent, about 10 minutes
Add the peanuts and salt to the onion mixture
Fill the pot with water until the peanuts are submerged, and use a large colander fitted into the pot to hold them under water
Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to medium, and simmer
Check the water level, and when it reaches the level of the peanuts, add more
Turn up the heat to medium-high and bring the peanuts to a boil; the lower heat to medium, and simmer
Repeat steps until peanuts are soft, 4 to 6 hours
Drain, and serve hot or cold
